node.title: Top firms exaggerating climate progress - study
node.description: Companies including Google, Amazon and Ikea are not meeting their own green targets, a study finds.

node.title: Venue outside Whakatāne being sought for trial over Whakaari eruption
node.description: The trial into the health and safety failings leading up to the Whakaari eruption is likely to be held outside Whakatāne.

node.title: Vaccination rates in area that is home to Gloriavale community improves
node.description: One of New Zealand's most remote and isolated communities has now reached 90 percent of its population over 12 getting at least one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine.

node.title: Officer should not have released police dog that bit man, IPCA says
node.description: An investigation has found the police were not justified in deploying a dog that bit a man during an arrest, requiring him to need stitches.

node.title: Man who worked for DHS admits sending fake government letter to couple
node.description: Ralph Karau, who once had a top-secret security clearance, invented a State Department official to confront the couple after his daughter alleged the two had mistreated her.

node.title: Man pleads guilty to historical indecent assault linked to Dilworth School
node.description: Alister Grant Harlow of Hillsborough pleaded guilty to three charges including two of indecent assault, dating back 30 years.

node.title: Able Fit program helps build strength: "It is a gym that believes in me!"
node.description: Some of the athletes are autistic, others have Down syndrome or cerebral palsy. Stronger muscles aren't the only benefit.

node.title: Supreme Court halts redraw of Alabama's Congressional map
node.description: A lower court had ordered the GOP legislature to draw a second Black-majority district.

node.title: Body recovered from Clutha River believed to be missing man
node.description: Police officers searching for a missing man in Central Otago have recovered a body from the Clutha River.

node.title: Labor Secretary Marty Walsh speaks to MLB and players' association
node.description: The sides appear far apart with the season just around the corner.

node.title: Canadian hockey players refuse to take to the ice
node.description: The Canadian women's ice hockey team refused to take the ice for nearly an hour at the Beijing Winter Games while they waited for the ROC's COVID-19 test results.

node.title: Anti-vaccine mandate protest convoy arrives at Parliament
node.description: Vehicles from the convoy have blocked a road next to Parliament and hundreds of protesters against Covid-19 vaccine mandates gathered on Parliament grounds.

node.title: Firefighters extinguish blaze in Auckland apartment building
node.description: Eight fire trucks attended the fire on Kingston Street this morning, containing it before it could spread to other floors.

node.title: Filling the big hole in Wairoa's dental service
node.description: Wairoa hasn't had a dentist for two years, and a recent volunteer clinic showed the gap is causing pain, but what's behind it and can it be filled?

node.title: NSO Group: Israel launches inquiry into police hacking claims
node.description: Israel's government will set up a commission of inquiry to examine allegations that the police used spyware to hack the phones of Israeli public figures without authorisation.

node.title: Tonga: How an internet blackout left many desperate for money
node.description: The telecommunications breakdown caused by Tonga's volcanic eruption and tsunami cut off a vital source of funds to Tongans at a time when they needed it most.

node.title: How U.S. tax law widens racial wealth gap
node.description: Law professor Dorothy A. Brown claims the U.S. tax system impoverishes Black Americans. Here's how.

node.title: 'We were really lucky': Schools escape major damage after rain floods grounds
node.description: Two Taranaki schools managed to escape rising floodwaters damaging classrooms after heavy rainfall over the long weekend. Audio

node.title: The deep unfairness of New Zealand public holidays
node.description: If you work weekdays you're probably enjoying a day off today - and if you are working, you're likely getting time and a half. But a surprisingly large section of our workforce doesn't get either…

node.title: National Archives transferred 15 boxes of Trump records from Mar-a-Lago
node.description: Among the documents now properly in the Archives' possession are letters between Trump and North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un.

node.title: White House task force releases labor union report
node.description: A new report includes nearly 70 recommendations to "promote worker organizing and collective bargaining for federal employees."

node.title: Biden says there won't be a Nord Stream 2 if Russia invades Ukraine
node.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz didn't explicitly say whether Germany would terminate the pipeline being built to send gas from Russia to Europe, via Germany.

node.title: U.S. to lift Trump-era tariff on Japanese steel
node.description: In 2018, the Trump administration imposed a 25% tariff on steel imports and a 10% tariff on aluminum imports from dozens of countries.

node.title: The Day in Falls
node.description: Sometimes the Olympics are about success. Sometimes they’re about the other side of it.

node.title: At least 1 dead in Washington grocery store shooting
node.description: The suspect, identified by police as a White man, is still on the run and is believed to be armed with a handgun.

node.title: Hong Kong's zero-Covid strategy under pressure as cases soar
node.description: Hong Kong is expected to report a record number of new Covid-19 cases, in the biggest test yet for its zero-Covid strategy amid a growing outbreak

node.title: Trio saved from rip in 'gnarly' conditions
node.description: Three men had a lucky day when an off-duty surf life-saver, who had just decided to spend another 10 minutes at Dunedin's St Kilda Beach, saved them from a "nasty" rip.

node.title: 64% of employees concerned about being in workplace as Omicron spreads - study
node.description: The employee survey also saw a rise in workers supporting a vaccine mandate in the workplace.

node.title: Children's Commissioner plan raises fears of 'diluting' role
node.description: The Detail - Planned legislation would replace the Children's Commissioner role with a board and permanently establish an independent monitor of Oranga Tamariki.

node.title: Convoy protesting at Covid-19 vaccine mandates begins to arrive at Parliament
node.description: Dozens of vehicles from a convoy protesting against Covid-19 vaccine mandates have arrived at Parliament while many more were travelling on the highway in to the the capital.
